meanings.definition: A hatred or fear of change or innovation.
meanings.sent1: Her misoneism made her reluctant to try new technology.
meanings.sent2: His misoneism prevented him from accepting the new company policies.
meanings.sent3: Despite his misoneism, he eventually embraced the idea of using a smartphone.
meanings.sent4: The misoneism in the town was like a dark cloud stifling progress.
meanings.sent5: The misoneism in her heart was a barrier to personal growth.
